column4: I have upgraded my kernel to 3.1.4-030104-generic and tried installing proprietary drivers after that, but it failed.
you are not using a kernel from the repos
how did you get the kernel? ppa? or compiled?
I know what a PPA is.
see the warning? if you want support contact the ppa maintainer
Well who's the maintainer? How do I get that info?
i don't know, i stick to the repos
Okay, I've tried downloading the drivers of the Nvidia site.
once again, we can't help you with that
anything you add outside of the official repos you need to get support from where you got it
you should be able to use the restricted drivers dialog thing
not sure if it would work with the kernel you installed though
However, it does not show up (not because of the kernel, it's because it's Maverick)
i think it is called jockey-gtk or gtk-jockey
